CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 11 - Freedom of assembly and association (Article 11-1 - Freedom of peaceful assembly)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant announced , as required by LAW , to ORG his intention to organise a demonstration on DATE on FAC in GPE , in front of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to deal with the application . It observed that on DATE the area in question had been declared , by ORG itself and for an indefinite period of time , a “ security operational zone ” ( biztonsági műveleti terület ) , in view of the tumultuous events in GPE in DATE . It was as such outside ORG jurisdiction as regards the prohibition of , or acquiescence in , a demonstration . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for judicial review , observing in essence that no decision on the merits of the case had ever been adopted by the administrative authorities DATE which excluded such a review .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy Head of ORG dismissed the applicant ’s further complaint . On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG , challenging the decisions of both DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Head of GPE Police dismissed the applicant ’s renewed complaint . On DATE the Deputy Head of ORG partly reversed this decision and instructed ORG to substitute the indefinite measure in question with one of definite duration . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s ensuing action , essentially endorsing the police authorities’ earlier reasoning . It pointed out that the proceedings only concerned the police ’s decision on non - competence and did not constitute review of the police ’s original decision declaring FAC a “ security operational zone ” .

CARDINAL . Upon a further complaint , on DATE ORG quashed the decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to ORG . In reaction to the applicant ’s petition for review , on DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case to ORG . The latter ’s procedure was then interrupted on DATE on account of the applicant ’s death . The applicant ’s son and heir joined the proceedings as successor on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the subject matter of the litigation pending before ORG was the police ’s original decision declaring FAC a “ security operational zone ” .

CARDINAL . In another case concerning the same area , on DATE a Mr PERSON challenged the police ’s very decision to declare FAC a “ security operational zone ” . On DATE the Budapest Police Commander rejected his complaint , but this decision was quashed by the ORG Commander on DATE . In the resumed administrative proceedings , on DATE the GPE Commander again rejected the complaint . On DATE the ORG Commander upheld this decision . PERSON challenged this ruling in court .
CARDINAL . Mr PERSON ’s action was dismissed by ORG . However , on appeal ORG quashed this decision , together with the one of DATE .
CARDINAL . In the resumed second - instance administrative proceedings , on DATE the ORG Commander again upheld the GPE Commander ’s decision . PERSON requested judicial review .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed , in judgment no . CARDINAL.K.CARDINAL.CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL . , both the first- and the second - instance administrative decisions and remitted the case to the GPE Commander . The court pointed out that the impugned decisions did not contain any concrete elements establishing the necessity and proportionality of maintaining the “ security operational zone ” after the prolongation of DATE . Nor did they address the plaintiff ’s suggestion that the mere fencing - off of ORG ’s immediate vicinity – rather than the global ban on FAC – would have been sufficient in the circumstances .

CARDINAL . In the resumed first - instance administrative proceedings , on DATE the GPE Commander partly sustained PERSON complaint , noting that , in the absence of evidence to the contrary , the proportionality of the impugned measure had successfully been challenged .
